fm2026Details: Magnus force model with perpendicular velocity vectors. Spin stored as ball.cvy (lateral) and ball.cvx (topspin). Curl force: spinFactor * (speed / 15.0) applied perpendicular to velocity direction every physics tick on ALL free balls (shots, passes, crosses, clearances). Topspin calculated from technique stat (>65 → topspin = (technique-60)/4.0). Spin dampens 95% per bounce (SPIN_DAMPING_GROUND=0.95). Constants: SPIN_FORCE_FACTOR=1.2 (updated from 0.8), AIR_DRAG_COEFF=0.015. calculateCurl() generates curl components from technique/curve/shooting/crossing stats and preferred foot. CONFIRMED: Curl is NOT limited to free kicks — it applies to any ball with spin components. Additional: ball dribble pivot at 12.0 rad/s for smooth direction changes.
legacyDetails: Polynomial equation-based curl. Curl stored as m_CurlVelocity (IntVector3). Formula: equation = 1 + (((v*v) * 0.5f) - (v * 1.5f)). Applied as: posx += (int)(equation * (pCVel.x * 0.003f)). Curl zeroed after bounce. Fixed curl divisor of 65. Constants: AIR_FRICTION=0.0002, curlamount=65.
gapAnalysis:
Different approaches: FM2026 uses physics-based Magnus force (simpler, more realistic), Legacy uses polynomial frame-dependent calculation (more complex, less physical). FM2026 adds topspin/backspin (Legacy has no vertical curl). FM2026 curl scales dynamically with ball speed; Legacy uses fixed divisor. FM2026 retains 95% spin per bounce; Legacy zeroes spin entirely on bounce. FM2026 applies curl to ALL free balls continuously. SPIN_FORCE_FACTOR increased to 1.2 (was 0.8) in 17 Feb update.

FM2026 exceeds Legacy here. No gap.
codeSuggestions: No fix needed — FM2026's curl model is physically more accurate than Legacy's polynomial approach.

fm2026Details: Post collision: 4 posts with FIFA geometry (52.5m, ±3.66m). Distance-based detection (BALL_RADIUS 0.11 + POST_RADIUS 0.06 = 0.17m). Vector reflection with restitution=0.6. Crossbar: 3 modes (under 50% bounce, over 70% bounce, face 40% reflection). Net: inside-goal zone detection with heavy damping (NET_DAMPING=12.0) and gravity assist. Emits BALL_COLLISION events.
legacyDetails: Post collision: stamped debounce (200 frames). Angle-based deflection with deflectiondiff normalized to HALF_BALL_SIZE. X velocity reduced by factor z, Y/Z halved. Crossbar: height-based deflection, upper/lower bar calculations. Netting: back net 95% X cull, side net 75% Z cull, top net variants. Uses p=1-6 collision type identifiers.
gapAnalysis:
FM2026 has modern physics-based collision (vector reflection, restitution coefficient). Legacy uses angle-based reduction with arbitrary multipliers. FM2026 adds explicit net damping zone (Legacy has separate net collision types). FM2026 uses continuous collision detection; Legacy uses stamped debounce.

FM2026 is MORE COMPLETE here — it has post, crossbar, AND net detection. Legacy has more granular net collision types (back/side/top separately) but FM2026's approach is cleaner.
codeSuggestions: Consider adding separate net collision zones (back net vs side net vs top net) for more realistic ball behavior in the net, similar to Legacy's p=1,2,3,4 system. Currently FM2026 treats the entire goal zone with uniform damping.

fm2026Details: Bounce detection at height<=0.11m. Vertical restitution: 65% (BOUNCE_DAMPING=0.65). Curl-to-velocity transfer: 1.5x multiplier. Spin zeroed after bounce. Ground deceleration: 9.0 m/s² (GROUND_DECEL). Stop threshold: |vh|<0.5 or planarSpeed<0.5 (ROLL_STOP_SPEED).
legacyDetails: Vertical restitution: 50% (GROUND_BOUNCE=0.5). Horizontal friction: 20% (GROUND_BOUNCE_FRICTION=0.2). Curl-to-velocity transfer: 10x multiplier. Spin zeroed after bounce. Rolling friction: frame-dependent (GROUND_FRICTION=10 * frame * 0.5). Stop threshold: speed < GRAVITY/2.
gapAnalysis:
Both have complete bounce physics with different parameters. FM2026 is MORE bouncy (65% vs 50% retention) but has less dramatic spin transfer (1.5x vs 10x). FM2026 uses constant deceleration (9 m/s²) which is more physically realistic than Legacy's frame-dependent friction.

No critical gap — different but both functional. FM2026 arguably more realistic.
codeSuggestions: Consider increasing curl-to-velocity transfer from 1.5x to something closer to 3-5x if balls feel too 'flat' after bouncing. The Legacy 10x is excessive but the current 1.5x may be too conservative for noticeable spin effects.

FM2026 MISSING: Legacy's quadratic condition-to-stat scaling (severely punishes low fitness). FM2026 has better: sprint system, urgency modifiers, collision avoidance fields.

feature: Realistic Match Balance for Full 90-Minute Simulation
fm2026Details:
FM2026 correctly simulates a full 90-minute match in real time (5,400 seconds, 108,000 ticks at 20Hz). However, the action rates, defensive mechanics, and shooting gates are calibrated for a much shorter simulation. The result is 180-270 shots per team per match, producing 23-18 and 32-26 scorelines. Real Premier League football produces 12-14 shots per team and 1.3-1.5 goals per team in the same 90 minutes.

The root cause is NOT the match duration — it is that actions happen too frequently and defences are too porous. Seven interconnected systems need retuning to achieve realistic match statistics while preserving the full 90-minute real-time simulation.

REAL FOOTBALL CALIBRATION TARGETS (Premier League 2024-25 per team per 90min):
- Shots: 12-14 | On target: 4-5.5 | Goals: 1.3-1.5
- Shot conversion: 9-12% | On-target rate: 33-38%
- Passes: 420-470 | Pass completion: 80-84%
- Tackles attempted: 15-18 | Tackles won: 10-12 (60-65%)
- Interceptions: 10-14 | Fouls: 10-12 | Corners: 4-6
- Ball in play: ~58 min of 90 (64%)
- Final third entries: 25-45 | Box touches: 25-35
- GK save rate: ~72%

movementController.js:16 (BASE_SPEED=3.2 — OK but defenders need faster reposition)

legacyDetails: Legacy produces realistic 2-3 goals per team because it compresses 90 display minutes into 600 seconds of simulation. All mechanics (decision cadence, tackle frequency, shot rates) are tuned for this compressed timeframe and naturally produce 20-30 shots per team. However, the GOAL is to keep FM2026's full 90-minute real-time simulation and instead tune mechanics to match real football statistics. gapAnalysis:
COMPREHENSIVE REBALANCE NEEDED across 7 areas to produce realistic scorelines in a full 90-minute real-time simulation. Current mechanics produce ~15-20x too many shots and ~15x too many goals compared to real Premier League football. Each area below contributes to the problem and all should be addressed together for best results.

AREA 1 — DECISION CADENCE (biggest single factor): Players decide every 0.5-1.15s, meaning ~2 decisions per second. Real footballers take 2-4 seconds between touches in build-up play. Slowing this down by 3-4x immediately reduces action frequency across the entire match.

AREA 2 — BALL CONTROL AND TRANSITION TIME: Control phase (0.2-0.8s) and action cooldowns (0.8-1.5s) are too short. A real footballer needs 1-2 seconds to control and look up, plus time for the pass to travel. Each possession chain should take 3-5 seconds per player touch, not 1.7s.

AREA 3 — DEFENSIVE EFFECTIVENESS: Interception radius too small (0.65-1.25m), tackle trigger too tight (1.4m commit, 3.0m challenge range), defenders walk at 2.2m/s during tactical repositioning. Defenders need to cover more ground, intercept more passes, and win more duels.

AREA 4 — PRESSING AND MARKING: Only 2 players press (should allow 3), trigger distance 12m (should be 18-22m), defenders abandon marking when ball crosses midline. These gaps create easy passing lanes and free attackers on transitions.

AREA 5 — SHOOTING DIFFICULTY: Thresholds 0.72/0.82 too easy from close range with boosts (1.44x inside 10m). Shot inaccuracy 4x still allows too many on-target shots over 5,400 seconds. Need higher thresholds and more inaccuracy to match 33-38% on-target rate.

AREA 6 — GOALKEEPER EFFECTIVENESS: GK save rate needs to be ~72% of shots on target. Current system may be below this. Dive speed, reaction time, and positioning all need tuning for longer match duration.

AREA 7 — DEAD BALL TIME: Real football has only ~58 min of 90 in play (64%). FM2026 has minimal dead ball time. More realistic set-piece setup times, throw-in delays, and free kick preparation would reduce effective playing time and total actions.

COMPREHENSIVE REBALANCE: 7 areas of change to achieve realistic scorelines (0-0 through 5-0 range, average ~1.4 goals/team) in a full 90-minute real-time simulation. Apply ALL areas together for best results — they are interdependent.

========================================
AREA 1: SLOW DOWN DECISION CADENCE
========================================
This is the single biggest lever. Players currently think 2x per second — they should think every 2-4 seconds during build-up.

File: playerStateController.js (lines 147-160)
Current:
  const base = 0.35 + (1 - vision / 100) * 0.40;  // 0.35-0.75s
  const variance = 0.15 + (1 - composure / 100) * 0.25;  // 0.15-0.40s
  return Math.max(0.50, base + randomOffset);

Suggested:
  const base = 1.5 + (1 - vision / 100) * 1.5;  // 1.5-3.0s
  const variance = 0.3 + (1 - composure / 100) * 0.7;  // 0.3-1.0s
  return Math.max(1.5, base + randomOffset);

Rationale: A 1.5s minimum (up from 0.5s) means players think every 1.5-4.0s. Over 5,400s, this reduces total decisions from ~10,800 to ~2,700 per player — matching real football tempo where a player touches the ball 40-60 times per match.

IMPORTANT: Consider adding a ZONE-BASED modifier — faster decisions in the final third (1.0s-2.0s) and slower in build-up (2.0s-4.0s). This creates realistic tempo acceleration near goal:
  const zoneFactor = isInFinalThird ? 0.65 : (isInOwnHalf ? 1.3 : 1.0);
  return Math.max(1.0, (base + randomOffset) * zoneFactor);

========================================
AREA 2: INCREASE BALL CONTROL AND TRANSITION TIMES
========================================

--- 2A: Longer control phase ---
File: playerAIController.js (lines 608-628)
Current:
  const controlTimeNeeded = Math.max(0.2, 0.8 - (controlAttr / 200));

Suggested:
  const controlTimeNeeded = Math.max(0.8, 2.0 - (controlAttr / 100));

New range: 0.8s (control=100+) to 2.0s (control=0). Average player (control=65): ~1.35s.
This simulates the time to trap, settle, and look up before deciding.

--- 2B: Longer action cooldowns ---
File: playerEngine.js
Current pass cooldown (line 81): 0.8s → Change to: 1.8s
Current shot cooldown (line 133): 1.5s → Change to: 3.5s
Current dribble cooldown (line 157): 1.2s → Change to: 2.5s

Rationale: After playing a pass, a player shouldn't make another decision for ~2 seconds (jog into space, reposition). After shooting, ~3.5 seconds (recovery, getting back in play). Combined with the 1.5-4s decision interval, each player touches the ball every 3-6 seconds — matching real football.

--- 2C: Longer possession time limit ---
File: playerAIController.js (DRIBBLE.POSSESSION_TIME_LIMIT)
Current: 2.5s → Change to: 5.0s
Rationale: Allows more build-up dribbling and holding play. 2.5s forces panic passing.

File: playerAIController.js (lines 630-651)
Current:
  const hesitationChance = clamp((0.3 - (compositeSkill / 100 * 0.3)) * fatigueImpact, 0.02, 0.5);

Suggested:
  const hesitationChance = clamp((0.5 - (compositeSkill / 100 * 0.35)) * fatigueImpact, 0.08, 0.6);

New range: 8% (elite) to 60% (low skill). This adds realistic pauses — even world-class players don't instantly execute every time they receive.

AREA 3: STRENGTHEN DEFENSIVE EFFECTIVENESS

--- 3A: Larger interception radius ---
File: gameEngine.js (_checkBallPickup, around line 280)
Current:
  const baseRadius = 0.65;
  const speedBonus = Math.max(0, 1 - planarSpeed / 12) * 0.6;

Suggested:
  const baseRadius = 1.4;
  const speedBonus = Math.max(0, 1 - planarSpeed / 18) * 1.0;

New range: 1.4m (fast ball) to 2.4m (slow ball). This means defenders in the passing lane actually intercept passes rather than watching the ball zip past within arm's reach. The increase from 0.65m to 1.4m reflects a real player's ability to stick out a leg, chest-trap, or head an interception.

File: challengeController.js (around line 124)
Current: challenge triggers within 3.0m
Suggested: increase to 4.5m
Rationale: A defender 4m away can lunge, extend a leg, or body-block. 3.0m is too tight.

File: aiPress.js (lines 214-238)
Current: 1.4m commitment to tackle
Suggested: 2.2m

File: playerEngine.js (around line 318)
Current: tactical positioning speed = 2.2 m/s (walking)
Suggested: 3.5 m/s (jogging) when ball is in own half, 2.8 m/s otherwise

Rationale: Defenders jog to position, they don't walk. 2.2 m/s lets attackers sprint past repositioning defenders every time.

File: supportController.js (around line 145)
Current: 0.9s formation freeze after turnover
Suggested: 0.4s

AREA 4: IMPROVE PRESSING AND MARKING
========================================

--- 4A: Increase press trigger distance ---
File: aiPress.js (PRESS_TRIGGER_DISTANCE)
Current: 12m → Suggested: 20m
Rationale: Modern pressing starts much further out. Liverpool's press triggers at 25-30m from the ball carrier in real life. 12m means only engaging when the attacker is already dangerously close.

--- 4B: Allow 3 players to press ---
File: aiPress.js (line 177)
Current: myRank <= 1 (max 2 pressers)
Suggested: myRank <= 2 (max 3 pressers)
Rationale: Real defensive pressing involves a ball-side triangle — one player presses, two cover passing lanes. This dramatically reduces easy passing options.

File: aiOffBall.js (lines 518-520)
Current: defenders completely stop man-marking when ball is in opponent half
Suggested: defenders in own half should ALWAYS track nearby attackers, regardless of ball position. Only defenders who have pushed up past midfield should drop marking:
  const shouldMark = !pastMidline || (player.pos.x * attackDir < 0);  // Always mark if in own half
Rationale: The current behaviour means on any turnover, attackers in the defensive half are completely unmarked for the first 1-2 seconds. This is the single biggest exploit for counter-attacks.

File: aiConstants.js (lines 9-10)
Current:

  THRESHOLD_DISTANT: 0.82

Suggested:

File: aiConstants.js (SHOT_INACCURACY_MULTIPLIER)
Current: 4.0 → Suggested: 7.0

Suggested:
  BASE_ERROR_MIN: 12.0
  BASE_ERROR_MAX: 40.0

--- 5D: Add team-wide shot cooldown ---
File: playerAIController.js or gameEngine.js
New mechanic: After any player on a team shoots, suppress all shot scores for that team by 50% for 15 seconds.
  if (matchState.lastShotTime[teamIdx] && (now - matchState.lastShotTime[teamIdx]) < 15.0) {

Rationale: Real football teams don't shoot every time they enter the box. After a shot, play typically resets — goal kick, corner, or the other team clears. A 15-second suppression creates natural gaps between shots matching real football rhythm of ~1 shot every 6-7 minutes per team.

Suggested: 1.03x at 25m, 1.08x at 16m, 1.12x at 10m (stacks to ~1.24x)

AREA 6: STRENGTHEN GOALKEEPER
========================================

File: keeperAction.js (reaction delay calculation)
Current: 0.03 * (1.5 - agility/200 - confidence/200) = 0.015-0.045s
Suggested: 0.02 * (1.5 - agility/150 - confidence/150) = 0.007-0.030s

Current GK_PARRY_RADIUS: 4.5m → Suggested: 5.5m
Rationale: GKs should cover more of the goal. This increases save rate toward the target 72%.

File: aiKeeper.js
The GK should narrow the angle more aggressively. Consider increasing the advance distance by 20-30% for central shots (ball within 15m laterally), so the GK cuts off more of the goal before the shot is taken.

--- 6D: Add shot-blocking by outfield defenders ---
New mechanic (suggested): When a shot is launched, any outfield defender within 3m of the ball trajectory and facing the ball should have a chance to block it (proportional to bravery + positioning attributes).   Target: 20-25% of shots should be blocked by defenders.
  Implementation: In the tick after a shot is launched, check each defender within 4m of the ball path. Block chance = (bravery/200 + positioning/200) * proximityFactor. If blocked, deflect ball with reduced speed.

AREA 7: INCREASE DEAD BALL TIME
========================================

Suggested: add 3-5 second delay for throw-in setup (player retrieves ball, walks to line, waits for teammates)

EXPECTED RESULTS AFTER ALL CHANGES
========================================

With all 7 areas applied together:
- Decision rate drops from ~2/sec to ~0.5/sec → ~4x fewer decisions
- Control + cooldown time means each touch takes 3-5s instead of 1.7s
- Defensive interceptions increase ~3x (larger radius + more pressing)
- Shot threshold + accuracy changes filter ~60-70% more shot attempts
- GK + shot blocking saves ~75% of on-target shots
- Dead ball time adds ~25 minutes of non-play

Net effect on shots: ~180-270 per team → ~10-16 per team (matches real football 12-14)
Net effect on goals: ~18-27 per team → ~1-3 per team (matches real football 1.3-1.5)
Expected scoreline range: 0-0 through 5-0, with most matches 1-0 to 3-2

========================================
TUNING PRIORITY ORDER
========================================

If implementing incrementally, apply in this order for maximum impact:
1. AREA 1 (decision cadence) — biggest single lever, ~3-4x reduction alone
2. AREA 5 (shooting difficulty) — thresholds + inaccuracy + team cooldown
3. AREA 3 (defensive effectiveness) — interceptions + tackle range
4. AREA 2 (control/transition times) — slows down action chains
5. AREA 4 (pressing/marking) — closes defensive gaps
6. AREA 6 (goalkeeper) — reduces conversion of shots that get through
7. AREA 7 (dead ball time) — final polish for realism

After each area, run 20+ test matches and compare stats against the calibration targets table. Adjust individual constants up or down based on results.
